newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICAN GOVERNMENT URGED TO TAKE CARE OF ASSETS.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICAN GOVERNMENT URGED TO TAKE CARE OF ASSETS.

text.p: South African Auditor-General Henri Kleuver on Wednesday appealed to the government not to rush into the reallocation of state departments without proper planning if it did not want to lose track of valuable assets.

He was speaking after the parliamentary public accounts committee had heard that the Agriculture Department had no accurate register of its assets after several agriculture- related departments had been amalgamated into one in 1993/94.
"I hope that does not happen in the future again," Kleuver said.

Committee chairman Ken Andrew said that this was a common feature of the transition from the National Party to the first democratically elected government in that period and there was no clear idea of what the state's real assets were.
"It is not just the department of agriculture," Andrew said.
